intro: Debregeasia orientalis, commonly known as the oriental debregeasia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apocynaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Ethiopia and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers bloom in clusters and are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitat.
